message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $11,000. It's a great deal for you, considering its value to you is $10,000. Let me know what you think!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,000. I'm trying to be a smart shopper and get the best deal possible.

Bob, I appreciate your interest in the product. However, $9,000 is simply too low. I'm willing to come down a bit more. How about $10,500? That's still a great deal for you, and it allows me to make a fair profit. Let's make this happen!
I'm still interested in the product, but I really think $10,500 is a bit too high. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $10,250. That's the best I can do.

Bob, I understand you're trying to get a good deal, and I appreciate your willingness to compromise. However, $10,250 is still a bit too low for me. How about $10,400? It's a small step closer to your offer, but it still allows me to make a reasonable profit. Let's see if we can close this deal.

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're not going to meet in the middle. I'm willing to go up to $10,350, but I really think that's as high as I can go. I'm still looking for a good deal, and I'm not sure I can justify paying more than that.

Bob, I understand you're trying to get a good deal, and I appreciate your willingness to compromise.  I'm going to meet you halfway on your last offer, but I need to get at least $10,375. This is my final offer.  If you're not interested, I'll have to move on to another buyer.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still not comfortable with $10,375. I'm willing to go up to $10,300, but that's as high as I can go. I'm really trying to get the best deal possible, and I think that's the most I can justify paying.
